article: "Mum, I want to make you a bet," I said. "If I go a whole year without TV, will you give me a hundred dollars?" "Well, if you can  _  do it, ..." "Of course I can," I replied, trying to convince  _  . In fact, all this started from my  _  of a picture in the newspaper. I couldn't bear to look at that boy. He said that he had  _  one year without TV for a hundred dollars,  laughing at  me with mocking eyes. It seemed he was saying, "I did it,  _  you can't!". I glared at the boy's face. That year I did a lot of things. For example, my father taught me to  _  , which became my favorite sport.  _  winter afternoons snowball wars with my neighbors offered daily drama. I went on bike trips with my friends and swam as much as a fish. It was unbelievable how much  _  I had without TV. I learned so many new games. I guess the  _  thing I learnt, though, was self-motivation . I started to do my homework. I went from a D student to an A student within a couple of  _  . I used to  _  reading if there were no  _  , but now I began to read and enjoy it. I could arrange off all the pictures just the way I wanted them--my own little TV, right  _  my head! I'm surprised what I did. I got a lot more from the  _  than just the 100 dollars!
